metadata.Title: CVE-2021-29987 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: After requesting multiple permissions, and closing the first permission panel, subsequent permission panels will be displayed in a different position but still record a click in the default location, making it possible to trick a user into accepting a permission they did not want to. *This bug only affects Firefox on Linux. Other operating systems are unaffected.*. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 91 and Thunderbird < 91.

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
